definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Because of how you reacted in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 一切皆由你早上的反应而起。

sentences.english: It was still pitch-dark when I started off from Delamu Inn.
sentences.chinese: 早上从德拉姆客栈出发时，四周还是漆黑一团。

sentences.english: So when I woke up early this morning at 8am it was actually only 7am.
sentences.chinese: 所以，当我早上8点醒来时，实际上才7点钟。

sentences.english: I was done out of $20 in the shop this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上我在商店里被骗走了20美元。

sentences.english: Getting up at 6 a. m. to watch the sun rise over Mei Li Snow Mountain was worth it.
sentences.chinese: 早上六点就起床去梅里雪山看日出是值得的。

sentences.english: M. and arrive there two hours later.
sentences.chinese: 我们早上六点半就上火车，两小时后到达。

sentences.english: My mother looked at me this moring.
sentences.chinese: 我妈妈今天早上来看我。

sentences.english: Steven was tardy this morning and alleges that his bus was late.
sentences.chinese: 芬今天早上迟到的说词是公车误点了。

sentences.english: Good morning, boys and girls. Nice to see you. I am Mrs Zhou .
sentences.chinese: 同学们早上好，我是周老师，见到你们很高兴。

sentences.english: They set off on a fine morning.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一个大晴天的早上出发。

sentences.english: He had his habitual breakfast, hamburger and ham sandwich every morning.
sentences.chinese: 他每天早上都是惯常的早餐，汉堡包和火腿三明治。

sentences.english: When Gaston arose in the morning, his wife had already departed.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上加斯顿起床的时候，他的妻子已经离开了。

sentences.english: The next morning they were summoned to see the commanding general.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上，将军召见他们。

sentences.english: He got up early this morning, so that he caught the first bus.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上他起的很早，因此赶上了头班车。

sentences.english: Morning, drive to Lijiang, the cultural center of the Naxi Minority.
sentences.chinese: 早上，乘车至丽江，这里是纳西族的文化中心。

sentences.english: In the morning two persons came up to the ditch.
sentences.chinese: 早上有两个人来到了水沟。

definition: at dawn/at first light/first thing in the morning
to get out of bed/to get up
in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
first thing in the morning/at daybreak
